security_audit.summary: Prompt-based CLI wrapper skill that executes Gemini CLI commands for code analysis. External command execution and network communication are necessary for its stated purpose. No obfuscation or suspicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Large codebase analysis requires significant manual exploration time. This skill wraps Gemini CLI to scan entire projects, identify patterns, and provide architecture insights automatically. Users receive AI-powered code analysis without writing complex commands.
actual_capabilities: Scan entire codebases with Gemini --all-files flag
Generate architecture diagrams and component maps
Identify code patterns with usage examples
Detect performance bottlenecks and code smells
Return raw analysis results without interpretation
limitations: Requires Gemini CLI to be installed and configured
Cannot analyze code without sending data to Gemini AI service
Only returns raw Gemini output without refinement

use_cases.title: Architecture Exploration
use_cases.description: Understand unfamiliar codebases quickly by generating architecture maps and component relationships.

use_cases.title: Codebase Auditing
use_cases.description: Identify code patterns, security concerns, and technical debt across large legacy projects.

use_cases.title: Multi-File Pattern Search
use_cases.description: Find all instances of specific patterns across projects to understand feature implementations.

best_practices: Install Gemini CLI before using this skill for the first time
Use --yolo flag only for read-only analysis tasks
Combine with other skills for complete development workflows
anti_patterns: Using for destructive operations without understanding the impact
Expecting refined output - this skill returns raw Gemini responses
Using without Gemini CLI installed or configured

faq.question: Is Gemini CLI required to use this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. You must install and configure Gemini CLI before running analysis commands.

faq.question: What data is sent to Gemini?
faq.answer: Code from your project is sent to Google AI services for processing through Gemini CLI.

faq.question: Can I use this with private repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, but any code you analyze will be processed by Gemini AI service.

faq.question: How is this different from Claude's native analysis?
faq.answer: This skill uses Gemini CLI for large-scale codebase scanning with specialized prompts.

faq.question: Does this work offline?
faq.answer: No. Gemini CLI requires internet connection to communicate with Google's AI service.

faq.question: Can I customize the analysis prompts?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides templates but you can write custom Chinese prompts for specific needs.
